avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanche danger is low. Wet snow is the main problem. Due to solar radiation, small wet loose-snow avalanches can release on very steep slopes naturally where there is sufficient snow on the ground. On very steep smooth slopes, esp. on shady slopes, small wet glide-snow avalanches are possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wet-snow avalanches can release naturally above hiking trails

snowpackStructure.comment: Skies on Saturday night will be partly cloudy. A melt-freeze crust will form only where there is sufficient outgoing radiation. During the daytime it softens due to warmth and solar radiation. The snowpack is thoroughly wet. A cohesive snowpack is found only on high-altitude shady slopes. On south-facing slopes the ground is becoming bare of snow up to summit levels.

tendency.comment: On Monday, wet-snow avalanches will increase due to rainfall. Cool temperatures at mid-week will make this danger recede.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Avalanche danger above 1600 m is moderate, below that altitude danger is low. Main problem: gliding snow. On very steep grass-covered slopes and rocks, wet glide-snow avalanches can release naturally. Large releases are sometimes possible in Allgäu.
Small wet loose-snow avalanches can release naturally in extremely steep terrain due to solar radiation.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wet-snow avalanches often have long plummet paths

snowpackStructure.comment: Skies on Saturday night will be partly cloudy. A melt-freeze crust will form only where there is sufficient outgoing radiation. During the daytime it softens due to warmth and solar radiation. The snowpack is thoroughly wet. A cohesive snowpack is found only on high-altitude shady slopes. On south-facing slopes the ground is becoming bare of snow up to summit levels.
